justification: The Pentacam 4 Maps Refractive report shows classic signs of keratoconus, including inferior steepening with an asymmetric bowtie pattern on the axial curvature map (yellow-orange hues inferiorly indicating increased power around 48-50 D), positive elevation (red island) on the anterior and posterior elevation maps suggesting anterior protrusion >15 μm and posterior >20 μm, and central/inferior corneal thinning (blue-purple hues centrally around 450-460 μm) on the pachymetry map.

justification: The Pentacam 4 Maps Refractive report for the right eye (OD) displays characteristic signs of keratoconus, including inferior steepening on the anterior sagittal curvature map with a maximum keratometry (Kmax) exceeding 47.2 D, a positive island configuration on the anterior and posterior elevation maps indicating corneal protrusion, and a thinnest corneal thickness below 500 μm on the pachymetry map, suggesting corneal thinning typically seen in ectatic disorders.
